net.atos.testeatos.controller

Class EmployeeRestController

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.atos.testeatos.controller.EmployeeRestController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/employees")
public class EmployeeRestController
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles HTTP requests to the application's REST endpoints. Allows the user to perform standard CRUD operations on the Employee's data repository using JSON.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Tiago de Morais Fran√ßa

      • EmployeeRestController

        public EmployeeRestController()

    • Method Detail

      • findAllEmployees

        @GetMapping(value="/list")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Employee>> findAllEmployees()
        Returns a ResponseEntity with a JSON object of a list of employees in its body. In case the case of an empty data repository, the ResponseEntity returned will have the Not Found header and an empty body.
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the servers response to the request. Can be a JSON object array of the Employees in the repository or have no content aside from the header
        See Also:
        ResponseEntity

      • addListOfEmployees

        @PostMapping(value="/add")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Employee>> addListOfEmployees(@RequestBody
                                                                                                                        java.util.List<Employee> employees)
        Saves the list of employees in the repository if it's valid. Returns a ResponseEntity with the appropriate response from the server.
        Parameters:
        employees - List of employees to be saved in the data repository
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the servers response to the request. Can be a List of the saved Employees or have no content aside from the header

      • getEmployeeById

        @GetMapping(value="/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Employee> getEmployeeById(@PathVariable
                                                                                                     long id)
        Returns a ResponseEntity with a JSON object of the employee entity with the given identifier. The ResponseEntity's body will be empty if no employee with that identifier could be found.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier of the employee entity.
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the servers response to the request. Can be a single Employee entity or have no content and a Not Found header

      • searchBySkills

        @GetMapping(value="/filter/{skills}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Employee>> searchBySkills(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                               java.util.Set<java.lang.String> skills)
        Returns a ResponseEntity with a JSON object of a list of employees in its body. The employees returned are only the ones that have any of the skills from the parameter. In case the case of no employees being found, the ResponseEntity returned will have the Not Found header and an empty body.
        Parameters:
        skills - Set of skills that will be used to filter the employee entities by
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the servers response to the request. Can be a list of employees filtered by skill or have no content aside from the header

      • getAllSkills

        @GetMapping(value="/skills")
public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllSkills()
        Returns a ResponseEntity of a JSON object that has all the skills employees have in the repository.
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with a list of all the employee skills from the repository in JSON format

      • updateEmployee

        @PutMapping(value="/edit/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Employee> updateEmployee(@PathVariable
                                                                                                         long id,
                                                                                                         @Valid @RequestBody
                                                                                                         @Valid Employee employee)
        Updates the Employee instance with the given identifier with the new informations from the parameter. Returns a .ResponseEntity ResponseEntity with either the updated employee in its body or an empty response with the Not Found header.
        Parameters:
        id - Identifier for the employee to be updated
        employee - Employee instance with updated data
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the servers response to the request. Can be a single Employee entity or have no content and a Not Found header

      • removeEmployee

        @DeleteMapping(value="/remove/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Employee> removeEmployee(@PathVariable
                                                                                                              long id)
        Deletes an Employee entity from the repository. Returns an empty .springframework.http.ResponseEntity ResponseEntity on success with a No Content header or a Not Found header if the employee was not found.
        Parameters:
        id - Identifier of the employee to be deleted
        Returns:
        A ResponseEntity with no content
